snippet.textDisplay: I'm a father to a young daughter.  I absolutely love that a group of men crafted a story where you get the "good" ending by being a good father to your daughter.  Specifically because they chose to define being a good father as having faith in your daughter's strength, and using that faith to give her the gift of faith in herself.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm a father to a young daughter.  I absolutely love that a group of men crafted a story where you get the "good" ending by being a good father to your daughter.  Specifically because they chose to define being a good father as having faith in your daughter's strength, and using that faith to give her the gift of faith in herself.

This explains so much. The series is awfully made. Except Henry Cavell nothing is good. Yennifer is bad story line as shown in the show is confusing and hence comes out as bad. snippet.textDisplay: Played The Witcher 3 and got the sad ending at first go. It was such a surprise that I wrongly chose 15 hours earlier before end of game. But it ended up as the perfect bittersweet moment to one of the best RPG game ever. My subsequent run throughs ended better but I wouldn’t trade that ending for anything. BTW the tv time jumps or flashbacks made it a little confusing but all in all, it’s a pretty decent adaptation. Thank you Henry Cavill for not screwing up Geralt!
snippet.textOriginal: Played The Witcher 3 and got the sad ending at first go. It was such a surprise that I wrongly chose 15 hours earlier before end of game. But it ended up as the perfect bittersweet moment to one of the best RPG game ever. My subsequent run throughs ended better but I wouldn’t trade that ending for anything. BTW the tv time jumps or flashbacks made it a little confusing but all in all, it’s a pretty decent adaptation. Thank you Henry Cavill for not screwing up Geralt!

snippet.textDisplay:
CD PROJEKT CONCLUDED AN AGREEMENT WITH ANDRZEJ SAPKOWSKI
After more than a year of negotiations, CD Projekt and Andrzej Sapkowski came to an agreement on the additional remuneration demanded by the writer for granting the rights to create virtual adventures of Geralt of Rivia.
Andrzej Sapkowski created the Witcher universe many years ago, without which, of course, no later games by the Polish studio CD Projekt RED would arise. Of course, it can not be hidden that only the virtual adventures of Geralt from Rivia, and in particular the third installment of the series managed to make the brand famous internationally. Unfortunately, the writer apparently underestimates the contributions of developers, in turn, he repeatedly admitted in interviews that the games "caused him a lot of stench", which he had to loosen later. It is about the fact that some people mistakenly believe that stories were created on the basis of video games, and not the other way round, which also shows which medium now has more power to reach the audience.
The author of the books also has another reason not to be sympathetic to CD Projekt, although in this case it was his fault, not the other side. Namely, the contract signed by Sapkowski, under which he sold them the right to make a game about The Witcher, demanding payment in advance and not wanting interest on the sale. Anyway - as he admitted - this amount turned out to be too small compared to what productions about Geralt from Rivia earned, and he did it because he simply did not believe in their market success, which theoretically should close the way to any claims in the future.
Not really, because they appeared more than a year ago, when the law firm representing the author of the saga about the adventures of Geralt of Rivia sent a letter to CD Projekt, which demanded as much as 60 million zlotys as additional remuneration. Of course, the Polish company did not intend to pay out such a huge amount of money for them, and therefore an even greater conflict arose between the writer and the creators. A large group of society took the side of CD Projekt in this war, finding Sapkowski's claims ridiculous. However, after months of negotiations, both the writer and publisher managed to reach a favorable agreement.
Unfortunately, we did not know the details of the signed contract in relation to the point in the documents obliging to protect the trade secret. It was noted, however, that "the adopted arrangements meet and fully explain the needs and expectations of both parties while respecting previously concluded agreements and outline the framework for future cooperation between the parties." In addition, the communication also stated that the signed contract gives CD Projekt new rights, as well as confirms the company's possession of the Witcher brand in the category of video games, comics and merchandising.
snippet.textOriginal:
CD PROJEKT CONCLUDED AN AGREEMENT WITH ANDRZEJ SAPKOWSKI
After more than a year of negotiations, CD Projekt and Andrzej Sapkowski came to an agreement on the additional remuneration demanded by the writer for granting the rights to create virtual adventures of Geralt of Rivia.
Andrzej Sapkowski created the Witcher universe many years ago, without which, of course, no later games by the Polish studio CD Projekt RED would arise. Of course, it can not be hidden that only the virtual adventures of Geralt from Rivia, and in particular the third installment of the series managed to make the brand famous internationally. Unfortunately, the writer apparently underestimates the contributions of developers, in turn, he repeatedly admitted in interviews that the games "caused him a lot of stench", which he had to loosen later. It is about the fact that some people mistakenly believe that stories were created on the basis of video games, and not the other way round, which also shows which medium now has more power to reach the audience.
The author of the books also has another reason not to be sympathetic to CD Projekt, although in this case it was his fault, not the other side. Namely, the contract signed by Sapkowski, under which he sold them the right to make a game about The Witcher, demanding payment in advance and not wanting interest on the sale. Anyway - as he admitted - this amount turned out to be too small compared to what productions about Geralt from Rivia earned, and he did it because he simply did not believe in their market success, which theoretically should close the way to any claims in the future.
Not really, because they appeared more than a year ago, when the law firm representing the author of the saga about the adventures of Geralt of Rivia sent a letter to CD Projekt, which demanded as much as 60 million zlotys as additional remuneration. Of course, the Polish company did not intend to pay out such a huge amount of money for them, and therefore an even greater conflict arose between the writer and the creators. A large group of society took the side of CD Projekt in this war, finding Sapkowski's claims ridiculous. However, after months of negotiations, both the writer and publisher managed to reach a favorable agreement.
Unfortunately, we did not know the details of the signed contract in relation to the point in the documents obliging to protect the trade secret. It was noted, however, that "the adopted arrangements meet and fully explain the needs and expectations of both parties while respecting previously concluded agreements and outline the framework for future cooperation between the parties." In addition, the communication also stated that the signed contract gives CD Projekt new rights, as well as confirms the company's possession of the Witcher brand in the category of video games, comics and merchandising.

snippet.textDisplay:
I chose the ending in which Ciri becomes empress, because a good father let's his daughter decide for herself (after raising her properly and teaching her how to tell right from wrong, of course), but next time - and after reading, what a dickwad Emhyr is - I will protect my daughter from that creep. She won't get any near to him and instead will become what she always wanted to be for a long time:
the first female witcher!



Also Yen all the way(even though she's hard work)!
snippet.textOriginal:

She won't get any near to him and instead will become what she always wanted to be for a long time:
